description: Fractal sequence induced by sqrt(2): for k >= 1 let p(k) be the permutation of 1,2,...,k obtained by ordering the fractional parts {h*sqrt(2)} for h=1,2,...,k; then juxtapose p(1),p(2),p(3),...
comments: A054073 generates the interspersion A054077; see A194832 and the Mathematica program.
mathematica: r = Sqrt[2];t[n_] := Table[FractionalPart[k*r], {k, 1, n}];f = Flatten[Table[Flatten[(Position[t[n], #1] &) /@ Sort[t[n], Less]],{n, 1, 20}]] (* A054073 *)TableForm[Table[Flatten[(Position[t[n], #1] &) /@ Sort[t[n], Less]], {n, 1, 15}]]row[n_] := Position[f, n];u = TableForm[Table[row[n], {n, 1, 20}]]g[n_, k_] := Part[row[n], k];p = Flatten[Table[g[k, n - k + 1], {n, 1, 13},{k, 1, n}]] (* A054077 *)q[n_] := Position[p, n]; Flatten[Table[q[n], {n, 1, 80}]]  (* A054076 *)(* _Clark Kimberling_, Sep 03 2011 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
